dc_description_s: This layer is a georeferenced raster image of the historic paper map entitled: Carte hydrographique de la partie septentrionale de la haute Ã‰gypt : ou sont indiquÃ©s les travaux d'arrosage exÃ©cutÃ©s ou Ã  exÃ©cuter d'aprÃ¨s les ordres de Son Altesse MehÃ©met-Ali, Vice-Roi d'Egypte, par M. Linant de Bellefonds ; gravÃ©e par Erhard. It was published by DÃ©pÃ´t de la Guerre in 1855. Scale 1:250,000. Covers a portion of the Nile River region near AsyÅ«Å£ and SÅ«hÄj, Egypt. Map in French. The image inside the map neatline is georeferenced to the surface of the earth and fit to the Egypt Red Belt projected coordinate system. All map collar and inset information is also available as part of the raster image, including any inset maps, profiles, statistical tables, directories, text, illustrations, index maps, legends, or other information associated with the principal map. This map shows features such as drainage, canals, roads, railroads, cities and other human settlements, administrative boundaries, ruins and historical sites, and more. Relief shown by hachures. Includes also text and notes. This layer is part of a selection of digitally scanned and georeferenced historic maps from the Harvard Map Collection. These maps typically portray both natural and manmade features. The selection represents a range of originators, ground condition dates, scales, and map purposes.
